course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Basic Electronics
course.description: Basic electronic concepts and components; DC, AC and transient analyses of analog electronic circuits; operational amplifiers and circuits; digital electronics includes binary number systems, Boolean algebra, and combinational and sequential logic. For non-ECE students only.
course.prerequisites: MATH 1014 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH 1024
course.corequisites: PHYS 1111 OR PHYS 1112 OR PHYS 1312

reviews.author: Raniaska
reviews.title: ECE course for non-ECE students
reviews.comment_content:
This course is a more simple version of ELEC2400, fitted for non-ECE students like MECH/AE.

Chapter 1: Fundamentals
Everything here is simply DSE knowledge (Current, Voltage, Power)

Chapter 2: DC Analysis
First half is still DSE-like, same voltage / current solving techniques but with more fancy / formal terms (KCL, KVL)

Second half is a bit new, but you should have no issues solving these problems as long as you apply the basics from above. (Superposition, Thevenin and Norton's theorem)

Note that this chapter will confuse you with the positive and negative signs, so please be aware of them.

Chapter 3: Operational Amplifiers
Things start to get very new from here. This chapter teaches you how this device increases the voltage gain with its internal design.

I recommend spending more time on this chapter than the previous two, you may consider watching YT videos as they really helped me to clear up concepts and techniques.
(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=idJEMYhrIfs)
(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lJDjWZqhpVc)

Chapter 4: Transiet Analysis
It's almost like DC Analysis, but instead of constant voltage and current, this one analyzes constantly changing ones. It introduces you the concept and application of a capacitor (and inductor, but we skipped it this term). A capacitor is simply a storage device that could be charged or discharged, and it has different voltage and current within a time period.

Although the First Order Linear Differential Equations look difficult at first glance, this chapter only requires you to memorize three equations.
1. Voltage of charging capacitor
2. Voltage of discharging capacitor
3. Current of charging/discharging capacitor (Same equation for current in both states)
(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X4EUwTwZ110)
(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PLQrPqYlPmI)

Chapter 5: Binary Arithmetic
My fellow ICT students, our knowledge is finally transferrable! This basically teaches you binary, decimal, hexidecimal, and octal numbers. Of course, binary would not be completed without 2's complement. Then add in a little bit of addition and subtraction operations, you got yourself a mostly very easy chapter!

The only new thing here is probably Analog-to-Digital Conversion and vice versa, but still, not difficult to understand in general.

Chapter 6: Boolean Algebra and Combinational Logic
Boolean Algebra is well... Boolean Algebra. Not difficult to learn, but it takes time to understand the identities and boolean laws. I personally think if you have taken any programming course, you could treat boolean laws as AND, OR, and NOT operations. It makes everything so much easier to understand. (Honorable mention to K-map, the ultimate solution to simplify functions!)

Now for the combinational logic... Jesus where do I begin with... it utilizes boolean algebra and introduces a few logic devices (Half Adder, Full Adder, 4-bit Adder, MUX, DEMUX, and ROM) All I could say is spend more time on this chapter, otherwise you'll be in trouble for chapter 7.

(K map: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RO5alU6PpSU)

Chapter 7: Sequential Logic
This difference between this and combinational logic is, this logic remembers the previous input and output then puts them into the next output, forming a sequence, as the name suggests. On the other hand, cominational logic only remembers the input but not the output of the previous stage.

There are two main components in this part, Latches and Flip Flops. These two are basically storage devices and they have different versions: Set-Reset (SR), Delay (D), Toggle (T), and Jack Kilby (JK) for both components. In a nutshell, a latch DOES NOT depend on time to modify the sequential output, while a flip flop DOES depend on time. Hope this one clears up the confusion a lot of students make.

Please take time to understand time graphs of different devices, you are certainly going to face them in your finals.

Besides lectures, there are tutorial sections and three labs. Tutorials basically reviews everything in the lectures, while the three labs require you to use a lab kit (which will be given to you at the beginning of the semester) to conduct experiments and write lab reports. Lab reports are graded but simple, just follow the instruction manuals step-by-step and write the values you see on the screen, very straightforward. Once you completed the report, ask the TAs to check your workings and they will give you a unique code to verify your completion.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Srivastava does well in teaching during lectures, and I could see he has passion in this course. However, perhaps I'm too weak at hearing, there are moments I could not hear clearly what he is saying, it may be a combination of heavy accent, masks on, and horrible speakers echoing. Also, his hand-writing on screen is a little... messy. But overall, he is a decent professor. [One of his famous quotes would be: "Does anyone have questions? If no, then I have a question for all of you." *Proceeds to ask us and solve the question on the powerpoint*]

Dr Ricky Choi (TA) has to be one of the BEST TAs in HKUST history. Not only does he show passion during tutorials, he is actively answering students' questions and his humor does make the vibe a lot better. Famous quotes: "If you don't understand this, see you next year!" or "Why do I define voltage as negative? Because I like it."
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: 10%
Labs: (3x5%): 15%
Midterm: 20%
Final exam: 55%

Just be a good boy / girl then you will have no problem in the first two categories.

Midterm includes Ch 1-3 only, while final exam includes everything. However, while final pastpapers from 2019-2021 have Ch 1-7, this year only includes Ch 4-7...

Overall, the exams are quite straightforward and I believe the grading *should* be fair.

Statistics:
Midterm: 24/30 (Mean: 21.5/30)
Final: 48.25/70 (Mean: 42.2/70)

Final grade: B
reviews.comment_workload: Very little. 7 homeworks in total, and around 5 questions per homework. As long as you understand the concepts in class, it shouldn't be too difficult to do. (Or you could search for answers on the Internet as homework questions are recycled over and over again in MANY COUNTRIES)

reviews.author: An225 Mriya
reviews.comment_content:
ELEC2420 is a more concise version of ELEC2400 provided for non-ECE students. The course is divided in two parts, covering analog and digital electronics:

Analog electronics:
1. Fundamentals
2. DC Analysis
3. Operational Amplifiers
4. Transient Analysis
Digital electronics:
5. Binary numerals
6. Binary algebra and computational logic
7. Sequential logic

While the course is generally easy, you may note that there is a huge gap between the course's analog and digital contents, with the contents about digital electronics being mostly irrelevant to analog electronics (perhaps an exception is when explaining the construction of 555 timer). You could be confused if one expect that all course content will be taught in a progressive manner.

Among all course contents, only Chapter 1 and (part of) 2 are related to DSE Physics. Moreover, you'll need to adapt negative notations for current and voltage, in which you won't see them in DSE, so previous DSE Physics experience won't be too useful here.

On the other hand, Minecraft players who mess with redstone electronics will have a larger advantage when understanding the digital components of the course (though don't expect any extra advantage if you can only build a switch-and-door system).

->Yes, I'm serious. As the course provide no lab opportunity for us to learn about more complex electronics components (like SR latches, T flip flops), building equivalent components in Minecraft do help with understanding their operation. After all, it can be confusing when facing all that master-slave structure of flip flops only by looking at the graphs and limited examples.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In general, Professor Srivastava taught in a satisfactory manner. Before lectures commenced, he'd allocate some 15 to 20 minutes to revise previous course content, which can be useful for those who skipped lectures. Despite being of Indian ethnicity, Professor Srivastava's English accent was clear, so misunderstanding shouldn't be a big problem.

However, some lecture examples mismatches with the difficulty of homework, which means homework questions are more difficult than lecture examples. This is especially true for the topic transient analysis. Moreover, when approaching the end of the course, a lot of complex digital electronic components were introduced with few examples provided, which can be fatal for those who have difficulty in understanding later content.

Speaking of Ricky Choi, he is definitely one of the best TA in HKUST. His tutorials were clarifying and helps with understanding lecture contents that are less explained by the professors. Moreover, he is very accessible by email: on average he'll reply your queries within a few hours in working days.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework (x7): 10%
Lab (x3): 15% - Full mark
Midterm: 20% - (35/40, mean 27.4/40)
Final: 55% - (63.5/70)
Unfortunately, as the course Canvas page was deleted after the final, my homework scores are essentially lost. I remember all of my homeworks score >80%, and I scored 100% for 1 or 2 easier homeworks.

Midterm and exam questions are generally not tricky as well. Most of them are designed based on previous past papers, probably having a few harder questions to differentiate the better students. Moreover, as previous finals are open-book, the past papers (which should be harder) can better prepare you for the closed-book final exam this time.

At the end I got an A for the course, which I think is satisfactory for a rather easy course in my study.
reviews.comment_workload:
In this semester, a total of 7 homeworks are issued to us. Apart from reported difficulty mismatch, they're generally easy once you understand course content.

There are also 3 labs in this course. One is about using PSpice, an electronics simulation program, to analyze analog circuits, while the other two require you to craft a vehicle that'll change its direction based on light difference. One tutorial introduces you to all the electronics appliances, and the other one is about assembling the vehicle. Honestly I don't think that the labs regarding building the vehicle is that useful towards the digital content: all you need to do is to follow the procedures, build, and debug the vehicle: it's more like "monkey see monkey do".

reviews.author: asc4155
reviews.title: Course and Test Content Mismatch
reviews.comment_content: The content is quite well subdivided and straightforward but the notes covered are not sufficient for answering hw/midterm/final questions. Recommend finding some other practice site, I didn't manage to do so, so scored poorly. Lab is very fun but unrelated to the items covered in the course, would recommend on-campus experience for the lab. There are 7-8 homework and 3 labs. Course is relatively easier as compared to other Electronics courses that I've taken.
reviews.comment_teaching: Both Professor and TA are very helpful and will take time to resolve your doubts if any. While the teaching is effective and useful for learning, there is a slight mismatch in the coverage of topics by the course material and exams.
reviews.comment_grading: Reasonable. No sky high means and standard deviations because most students felt the content mismatch problem. Scored an A- with Mean+SD marks in both midterm and final. Scored ~95% in homeworks and labs.
reviews.comment_workload: Medium-light workload, did not attend classes, just saw recordings at 2x before hw/midterm/final. Labs are hectic but fun. Would suggest keeping up with the classes, but easier to see at the pace

reviews.author: dwivek1
reviews.comment_content:
Most of the content at the beginning of the course is an extension of what is taught in high school. The content builds on the previous topics so if you aren't caught up with the ideas of the lessons, it can be difficult to keep up.

They cover the following chapters:
1) Fundamentals Chapter
2) Resistive Networks and DC Analysis
3) Op Amps and Circuits
4) Reactive Elements and Transient Analysis
5) Binary Number Arithmetic
6) Boolean Algebra and Combinational Logic
7) Sequential Logic
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor always pauses to ask if there are any questions and also provides problems to solve together so we can understand the concept better. At the beginning of the lesson, there is also some time alloted for revision of the last lesson so we can be caught up with the ideas discussed. Very simple explanations and always showing the best way to solve problems.

Ricky is always available to answer questions or if there are any problems. His tutorials are engaging and often go over the small points that the professor may have not emphasized in greater deal.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% Hw
15% labs
25% midterm
50% finals

Relatively decent grading, they also release hw solutions so we can check over solutions.
reviews.comment_workload: Relatively fine workload, just finish the hw which is released every week or 2 weeks. It takes about an hour or two to finish. Other than that, keep up with the lectures because sometimes the problems discussed in class shows up in hw or exams but if you don't know where it is from, it can be difficult to solve.

reviews.author: MS01
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1: Fundamentals
Chapter 2: Resistive Networks and DC Analysis
Chapter 3: Op Amps and Circuits
Chapter 4: Reactive Elements and Transient Analysis
Chapter 5: Binary Number Arithmetic
Chapter 6: Boolean Algebra and Combinational Logic
Chapter 7: Sequential Logic

You may refer to the attachment for details.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching of the Prof. Ki is boring. Although he explains everything in details, the teaching pace is quite slow. As he will provide lecture videos, you may skip his lesson and watch the lecture videos by yourself.

However, even you skip all the lectures, I recommended you to attend the tutorial. Ricky will teach you exam skills and concepts in a clearer way.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework: 10%
Labs (Total: 3):15%
Midterm: 20%  (mean: 31.4/40 ; SD: 7.8)
Final exam: 55%  (mean: 41.2/60 ; SD: 13.3)

Homework and Labs are easy to get full mark. In the tutorial, Ricky will teach you how do solve homework problems. Besides, the selected homework problems are quite easy.

Labs are also easy to get full mark because TAs are willing to help you when you face difficulties. Just follow the Lab Manual and you will be fined.

Midterm is easy and many people can get full-mark, while the final exam is more difficult than the midterm exam.
-------------------------------------------------------------
My Score:

Homework: 100%
Labs: 96%
Midterm: above mean 0.3 SD
Final Exam: below mean 0.4 SD

Final Grade: B-

Quite surprising, I initially thought that I will get into C range.
reviews.comment_workload:
6 Homework
3 Labs

There are also some optional exercise for revision that are not required to hand in.

reviews.author: SamuelLee
reviews.title: thanks for the extra time in the exam
reviews.comment_content:
First half: Analog circuits, including DC analysis, Op amps and transient analysis.

Second half: Digital stuff, including number systems, boolean algebra, combinational and sequential logic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor explains the concepts clearly and has a lot of extra examples for us to complete.

The TA clears the concepts and helps us well during assignments and exam review, despite a bit of mismatch.

But, they have given us EXTRA TIME to finish the midterm and final exams. This is super rare. I really like this kind of professors towards struggling students.
reviews.comment_grading:
10% homework (one 88% and the rest 100% for me)
15% labs (one 95%, one 100%, one 55% for me, the last one was really struggling hard to build the car)
20% midterm (mean: 21.5/30, I got 19.75/30)
55% final (mean: 42.1/70, I got 48/70)
Total: 73.2/100

My final grade is B, a great recovery from a below mean midterm exam.

For this semester the exams are significantly different from past exams, because this is the first semester that Srivastava is the only professor teaching this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Most of the workload comes from understanding the logic, especially when it comes to digital parts.
The assignments don't take long to complete btw.

reviews.author: FrostyP4nc4kes
reviews.title: Easy and Fun class (if you understand content)
reviews.comment_content:
1) Basic Introduction about electric voltage, power, current
2) Resistor circuit analysis(hardest chapter in my opinion) They took what I learnt in AP Physics C E&M and threw it in the bin xD. Covers Basic resistor analysis, but then branches off into nodal analysis and superposition. This includes Thevenin and Norton equivalent circuits which was the biggest pain in my backside. A lot of critical knowledge about short circuits, current direction, as well as a good sense of intuition will be needed. OH yeah also understanding voltage and current dividers is a life saver.

3) Operational Amplifiers
These may seem daunting when looking at it, but then it's actually really easy once you apply KCL at each point. That being said be very careful with your algebra, I forgot to put a denominator on the mid term and lost 4 points :').

4) Transient analysis. Overall the equations are just given to you on a plate, so just memorise and you'll be fine.

5) Binary arithmetic. Really simple, hardest part is going to be 2's compliment, which is actually relatively easy to do, but kinda hard to see whats going on. In the end you can just get away with memorising what to do.

6) Combinational logic
Honestly its just boolean logic. I really like this unit because we were introduced to multiplexors, adders, and ROM, as well as decoders and logic gates. It is best if you attend the classes and really understand what each lesson goes through or you will sorta struggle. Oh yeah also k-maps are a lifesaver, I recommend watching some Organic chemistry tutor videos about this because the lecturer didn't really do that well explaining, but once I watched the vid my mind was blown.

7) Sequential Logic
Honestly, this can seem super daunting. But just take time to look at some videos online on how to analyse SR latches, D, T, and K flip flops, honestly, the hardest part is going to be graphing a time graph, but again if you follow what the lecturer goes through in class you should have no problem.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Ki is a pretty great teacher who adds his sense of humour into the class. He does teach most things very thoroughly but again some things like nodal analysis, thevenin and norton thereom, k maps, and latches and flip flops are not taught very well. Go watch organic chem tutor. like seriously I'm not kidding.

Ricky Choi is my favourite TA, he is very passionate, and he explains things really well. He is very easy to contact and will help you out especially if you need to do make up labs (for a legitimate reason lolol)
reviews.comment_grading:
HW 10% 7 assignments - skipped a few whoops but doesn't matter too much, still recommend doing them just to review for exam

Labs 15% 3x5%- Full(just complete it and get TA to sign name and you get full)

Midterm 20% 33/40 (mean 27.4)
Do mocks and practice superposition cuz that stuff is hard as frick. also double check ur algebra

Final 55% 67/70 (mean was 39 on canvas)
Lucky no superposition on my exam, but uhh yeah I would recommend going through the real world examples from the lecture notes.

End result: A
reviews.comment_workload: Close to nothing, 7 hw, apart from the 1st and 7th one everything is due every 2 weeks, and you can get away with doing them last minute.

reviews.author: 雨季之涯
reviews.title: MECH仔讀既EE course
reviews.comment_content:
midterm前都係D基本野，DSE學哂再重溫一下
midterm後真係要睇下lecture notes
*最緊要上齊tut*
Course description:
Basic electronic concepts and components; DC, AC and transient analyses of analog electronic circuits; operational amplifiers and diodes, and their circuits; digital electronics include binary number systems, Boolean algebra, and combinational and sequential logic.
Chapter 1 Fundamentals
Chapter 2 Resistive Networks and DC Analysis
Chapter 3 Op Amps and Circuits
Chapter 4 Reactive Elements and Transient Analysis
Chapter 5 Binary Number Arithmetic
Chapter 6 Boolean Algebra and Combinational Logic
Chapter 7 Sequential Logic

Assessment Weight
Homework 10%
Labs (3x5%)
Midterm 20%
Final exam 55%
主要都係midterm同final分高下，lab同assignment差唔多個個都滿分

可以唔洗買書
reviews.comment_teaching:
lecture垃圾
上黎都浪費時間，又有lecture video可以睇
可以自己睇lecture notes就夠
*最緊要去上tut*
Ricky會講D最重要既野
佢講過既都會考
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignment同lab差唔多滿分
得1份assignment少3分(47/50)+1份lab少6分(34/40)
Midterm 37.5/40 (Mean:31.4,SD:7.8)
Final 48/60 (Mean:41.2,SD:13.3)
最後A- (87%/100%)
我估應該岩岩好邊緣位，本身以為B+
好好龜
多謝Ricky~~~
reviews.comment_workload:
今個sem有6份assignments
差唔多每個sem既assignment都一樣
可以周圍r sources
真係唔識可以上tut問ricky
tut通常會講埋D功課
Workload近乎0
功課人人都差唔多滿分

reviews.author: dd-450
reviews.title: I love you, Ricky!!!!
reviews.comment_content: really basic eletronic...
reviews.comment_teaching:
Ricky, Ricky, Ricky!! The best TA and the guy with best teaching in HKUST I've ever seen.
You may skipped all the lectures, but please go all the tutorials, if you do want a good grade.
And connect with Ricky if you have any difficulties.
reviews.comment_grading:
It seems everyone can get full marks in lab and hw.
I nearly get full mark in midterm and final. And fianlly I get A+ in this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
Homework is quite simple, and quite short. You can finish it within 1 hour.
No lab reports.

reviews.author: Hoegaarden
reviews.title: Damnnnnn
reviews.comment_content:
E&M
If you have studied Phys 1114, it would be less rough for you.
Circuit part is not too hard though.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is okay. But if you do not revise after lecture, no matter how good his teaching is, you may still end up getting trouble in the quiz, mid term and the final
reviews.comment_grading: If you have finished all the homework, then should be okay. The mean of this course won’t be too high or too low. If you get 100% of everything, you will surely get A+. Just a warm reminder that there are always some crazy men who scored all the marks in every single part.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is okay. There is lab. They won’t be too hard if you know how to do them. If you have E&M background, it won’t be too hard for you. They are quite fun actually.

reviews.author: asdgfasdf
reviews.comment_content: Pretty easy content which contains many materials that learnt from high-school.Anyone who didn't learn physics will also find this course easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Tutorial session is pretty good and Ricky is a good tutor.Lecture is not that good but it is acceptable.
reviews.comment_grading: Mid term and Exam is pretty easy and I knew many people get A- or above in this course.I was above mean around 0.5 sd in both final and mid-term exam and turns out i get an A.
reviews.comment_workload: Only assignments each week but tutorials always teach us to do the homework.So it's pretty simple.Although there are quite many labs, it is not hard at all and pretty easy to do so.

reviews.author: mechdog
reviews.title: tutorial 值得你上 感受Ricky ga 五速嘴
reviews.comment_content:
教基礎elec course
如果讀過elec1100,大部份野會識

Course Outline:
Chapter 1 Fundamentals
Chapter 2 Resistive Networks and DC Analysis
Chapter 3 Op Amps and Circuits
Chapter 4 Reactive Elements and Transient Analysis
Chapter 5 Binary Number Arithmetic
Chapter 6 Boolean Algebra and Combinational Logic
Chapter 7 Sequential Logic
reviews.comment_teaching:
有lecture video, 基本上可以5洗上lecture (冇計professor 講得有小小悶)
tutorial 係教得幾好
主要會教你點做hw,有咩野5識都可以問,所以最好5好走
(hw 最好自己做 midterm同 final 會出返類似題目)
reviews.comment_grading:
HW 10%
Labs 15%(有3個)
Midterm 20%
Final exam 55%

小弟 HW 同 lab 全部滿分,
Midterm 25.5/40 (mean 31.4 sd 7.8)
Final exam 37.5/60 (mean 41.2 sd 13.3)
最後有b-
reviews.comment_workload:
5算太大workload (lecture 基本冇上過, 只係上tutorial)
lab跟住d野做都5太難
大約1至2星期交一次hw
midterm 同 final 温幾日都應付到

reviews.author: JhanNG
reviews.comment_content: As the course title, it's the basic electronics. Very basic stuff in first few chapters, probably learnt by most students in high school. The last few chapters become more difficult when it involves logic gates and its application. Acceptable overall if you work hard enough. 7 chapters in total.
reviews.comment_teaching: Lecture videos are available. I personally find his lecture boring, so I skipped all classes. His teaching is quite ok actually, which sometimes helps understand better.
reviews.comment_grading:
HW 10%
3 Labs 15% (3*5%)
Midterm 20%
Final 55%

Midterm is easy, and it is pretty similar to past year questions. Final is much harder, so do work hard to prepare for the final. Some questions are same with the previous finals too.
Got full mark in midterm and got deducted 4 or 5 marks in final (can't remember), got an A at the end.
reviews.comment_workload:
A HW for every chapter, 7 in total. Exactly the same with the HW of previous semesters, so try to find someone who has taken this course for the answers. However the questions are not hard though.
The lab session is about finding a good lab mate. Seek for help from older TAs, they have more patience.

reviews.author: WYKEI
reviews.comment_content:
Basic electronic concepts and components; DC, AC and transient analyses of analog electronic circuits; operational amplifiers and circuits; digital electronics includes binary number systems, Boolean algebra, and combinational and sequential logic.

Extensive lecture notes, tutorial note sand lab manual are provided and could be downloaded from the course website.Additional problem are posted with numerical solutions for students to conduct self-learning.
Besides web materials, students are encouraged to read the textbook to learn the subject systematically:
Textbook:D. V. Kerns Jr. and J. D. Irwin, Essentials of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Pearson, 2004/2014.

Chapter 1: Fundamentals
Chapter 2:Resistive Networks and DC Analysis
Chapter 3: Op Amps and Circuits
Chapter 4:Reactive Elements and Transient Analysis
Chapter 5: Binary Number Arithmetic
Chapter 6: Boolean Algebra and Combinational Logic
Chapter 7: Sequential Logic

This is an essential course for mech student, comparing to mech course, the content of ELEC2420 is much better. Although it becomes difficult after the mid-term, you can follow it through notes.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching of the professor is boring and you may be confused.
However, the lab section will become tutorial if there is no experiment. Strongly advise to attend all the lab section even though you do not attend the lecture. They will teach the exam skill and the problem of homework.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework  10%
Labs(3*5%)  15%
Midterm      20%
Final exam   55%

Attend all lab+ midterm slightly above mean + final meet the mean = B-
reviews.comment_workload:
The most of the problems of homework will be solved during lab.
There are only three labs and TA will help you.
Midterm is easy to get a good grade but final is not. If you want to get a A grade, need to work hard in the mid-term.

reviews.author: 陳文揚
reviews.title: Basic Electronics
reviews.comment_content: The content of this course is considered quite simple and easier compared to other ELEC courses, since this course is mainly for mechanical engineering students.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ki teaches the materials in detail, which may suit those who want to learn the stuff taught thoroughly, but other students may find his teaching boring. Tutorials by Ricky are really good as they are simple yet easy for students to understand, especially for those who cannot catch up with lectures. Lecture videos are also provided after lectures for students to recap the materials taught, and may be useful when preparing for the final exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework 10%, Labs 15% (3x5%), Midterm 20%, Final exam 55%
The midterm is pretty easy (mean 32/40, sd 8), but the final exam is surprisingly quite tough compared to previous finals (mean 39/64, no sd). Most students are able to score high for the midterm, assignment and labs. Overall, the grading is pretty fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
Attendance is not taken during lectures and tutorials but it is highly recommended to attend them, especially the tutorials. There are also lab sessions, three in total.
Assignments are given every fortnight, and are short and simple, mostly to test students whether they have grasped the basic concepts of the contents already taught in lectures.
Lab sessions are also not tough as they serve as simple teaching materials for students to learn how to use basic electronic equipments.

reviews.author: Evil
reviews.comment_content:
MECH人專屬既ELEC course，好多basic野: Voltage, current, resistance , power
另外有DC Analysis， operational amplifiers; binary number systems, combinational and sequential logic.
内容唔太難，最重要係理解，明曬就至少B range
reviews.comment_teaching: 冇點認真上過堂，其實只要上足D Tutorial就夠，tutor Ricky教得好好，都幾清晰，但係有時D野會跳得好快，可能會跟唔上，但係overall都係好好。另外係midterm同final前各會有一個review session幫你溫書。
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework        10%
Labs (3x5%)     15%
Midterm            20%
Final exam        55%

midterm final 高1sd
功課同lab大部分都滿分
>>> A
reviews.comment_workload:
最大既workload就係HW，但係其實D功課全部都係輕鬆做，唔會好難，即使唔識做都可以揾sourse。
至於lab呢，有讀過ELEC1100就輕輕鬆鬆，同樣有sourse。

reviews.author: bupa
reviews.comment_content:
content to be tested in midterm is easy (DC circuit, amplifier).
Final exam is accumulative, including transistor, binary numbers, combinational & sequential logic. you have to know how to design logic circuit with certain functions
reviews.comment_teaching:
the prof is clear
the tutor is enthusiastic and the tutorials are good to check your concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
lab(10%)  hw(10%)  midterm(20%)  final(60%)
the mean is high in both exams (7x-80%). if your overall score is more or less the average score, you will get B-
reviews.comment_workload:
weekly hw (6 in total), a simple worksheet for each of the 3 labs
you will be constructing circuits on a breadbroad in the labs

reviews.author: Fishball
reviews.title: 其實logic野幾好玩
reviews.comment_content:
主要係教你係細電路版上面點樣連circuit
如果對logic gate好有興趣就正啦
因為成個Course教既野都係base on logic,
你如果理解到其實唔會好多野要記
同埋真係幾好玩
考試唔識都可以撞,
反正好多係1同0姐
reviews.comment_teaching:
照舊俾C,因為無咩上過堂
但係ricky真係唔話得<--TA
教得又好
又俾心機
會捉midterm考得差既去補底
改midterm,final又改得快(雖然唔係咩好事
個B係俾ricky既
reviews.comment_grading:
主要睇miderm final
因為assignment個個都full mark
我mean左右 B range
係科大黎講算係咁,
只要明白logic個concept就起碼B range,

利申:溫書果陣用minecraft 紅石溫, 有B都算係咁
reviews.comment_workload:
無workload咁濟,
得閒拎下source,
去做Lab跟住圖做就得
做完lab唔明既話係正常,
睇得明notes就得

reviews.author: 浪子
reviews.title: mid term 輕鬆, final難到hihi
reviews.comment_content:
比mech 仔讀的elec course
有中學phy 計下Resistance, op amp, cap, Ind, logic
後面果d幾難
content: mid term, final exam , assignment, lab assignment
workload 大嘅, 不過assignment 都係抄書,所以有source 就ok
reviews.comment_teaching:
mid term 果d 就輕鬆的, final 後半個part 真係有d難, 後悔走左堂, professor 教得都算ok,聽下係好事
最神係tutor Ricky, 教得勁好,超好, 唔上佢d堂真心on 9 ,玩命
你上過就會明, 好後悔final exam review 冇上,走去睇dance so ,最後below mean, mean term review 上左就full 左mark
reviews.comment_grading:
算係咁, 唔太差la
mid term final 分高下
reviews.comment_workload:
assignment
lab assignment
mid term
final exam
assignment 有source
lab assignment 都有source
抄source 就full mark

reviews.author: 型男
reviews.comment_content:
It is about Basic electronic concepts and components. The content is a bit Secondary Stuff at the beginning. I should say those content before MidTerm is super easy but after the MidTerm, it is a totally different story, especially for Boolean Algebra, Combinational and Sequential logic.

Ch 1 Fundamentals (Secondary School's Stuff)
Ch 2 Resistive Networks and DC Analysis (Secondary School's Stuff)
Ch 3 Op Amps and Circuits
Ch 4 Reactive Networks and DC Analysis
Ch 5 Binary Number Arithmetic
Ch 6 Boolean Algebra and Combinational Logic
Ch 7 Sequential Logic
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is passionate in teaching and explaining difficult parts for students. However, I can see that many people are skipping his lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Homework   10%
Labs(3x5%) 15%
MidTerm       20%
Final Exam   55%

For Lab Score:
Lab Performance: 20%
Lab Report: 80%

MidTerm Mean: (31.4/40)
Final Mean: (40.7/61)

I got 33/40 in MidTerm, 50-55/60 in Final Exam and all the Labs and HW Full Mark.
It turns out A- at the End.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is lenient.
Three Labs in total. (The only part attendance is needed)
7 Homework in total. The first few HW are very easy but the last few can make your mind blown

No attendance is needed for the lecture. Some say that Tutorial is very good, but I only attended once because he spoke too fast....
But, it worth trying.

reviews.author: Cheuk Wang
reviews.title: EASY
reviews.comment_content:
Course Outline:
Chapter 1 Fundamentals
Chapter 2 Resistive Networks and DC Analysis
Chapter 3 Op Amps and Circuits
Chapter 4 Reactive Elements and Transient Analysis
Chapter 5 Binary Number Arithmetic
Chapter 6 Boolean Algebra and Combinational Logic
Chapter 7 Sequential Logic

Basic electronics that is covered in DSE physics. The content is easy.
reviews.comment_teaching: hv lecture video so no need to attend the lecture
reviews.comment_grading: good grading. Remember to do the past paper!  The format is the same as past paper. Last semester, even a question is copy and paste.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 assignment every week
a midterm and a final

reviews.author: cyleebb
reviews.comment_content: 唔同TOPIC冇乜關聯，唔識前都可以識後，溫下就OK
reviews.comment_teaching: RICKY解釋得比較清晰同詳細，唔識可以留低問。KI 就講野好窒，一舊一舊咁
reviews.comment_grading: 只要功課做好啲 唔識都可以問, 臨考前溫下都有靚GRADE
reviews.comment_workload: 整體而言功課量唔算多，TUTORIAL 會講下功課，所以唔算難做
